subject: Career
title: The Sunk Cost Trap in Careers
description: A fast breakdown of The Sunk Cost Trap in Careers for builders.

hook.text: He spent ten years becoming a lawyer. Leaving felt like wasting a decade. So he stayed miserable.

buildup.text: The sunk cost fallacy: continuing an investment because of what you've already spent, not future value.

discovery.text: Kahneman and Tversky showed that humans irrationally weigh past investments over future outcomes.

twist.text: Your past investment is gone regardless. The only question is: what's the best path forward from here?

climax.text: Reframe: those years weren't wasted. They gave you skills, perspective, and clarity about what you want.

punchline.text: Don't let yesterday's investment trap tomorrow's potential.

quiz.question: What is the sunk cost fallacy in career decisions?
options: Staying because of past investment instead of evaluating future value
